title: Security Testing
summary: The Quarkus documentation on Security Testing provides comprehensive guidance on testing the security implementations within a Quarkus application. It covers configuring user information for various environments, utilizing the 'quarkus-test-security' extension for testing security with different user identities or without authentication, and mixing various authentication methods in tests like Basic Auth and Bearer Token. Additionally, it includes guidelines on path-based and form-based authentication, as well as mocking authorization services like OAuth2 and OIDC using Wiremock. Important annotations such as '@TestSecurity' are also elaborated for effectively controlling security contexts during testing.
